physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. A was alert, oriented, and cooperative but marked by slowed responses. Mood was depressed with constricted affect; no suicidal thoughts, delusions, or hallucinations. Bradykinetic with increased muscle tone.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mr. A's mood and intellectual function improved with treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. B was alert, attentive, and well-oriented. Marked restlessness with repetitive mouth movements, dystonia of the right hand and shoulder, and slight choreiform movements of the right upper extremity.
Mr. C was alert and oriented with a depressed mood and ideas of persecution. He exhibited prominent buccolingual dyskinesia and choreoathetotic movements of the trunk and neck.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive intellectual decline noted across serial psychological tests.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. D appeared slowed with a full range of affect; normal language and recent memory but deficits in attention and long-term memory. Exhibited tardive dyskinesia and slow, slightly wide-based gait.
Mr. E displayed marked emotional lability and depression following head trauma. Neurological evaluation showed no basic abnormalities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One year later, symptoms recurred including severe dysarthria and emotional lability; developed parkinsonism features.
